java.lang

Class UNIXProcess.ProcessPipeInputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.InputStream
      • java.io.FilterInputStream
        • java.io.BufferedInputStream
          • java.lang.UNIXProcess.ProcessPipeInputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable
    Enclosing class:
    UNIXProcess

    static class UNIXProcess.ProcessPipeInputStream
extends BufferedInputStream
    A buffered input stream for a subprocess pipe file descriptor that allows the underlying file descriptor to be reclaimed when the process exits, via the processExited hook. This is tricky because we do not want the user-level InputStream to be closed until the user invokes close(), and we need to continue to be able to read any buffered data lingering in the OS pipe buffer.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws IOException
        Description copied from class: BufferedInputStream
        Closes this input stream and releases any system resources associated with the stream. Once the stream has been closed, further read(), available(), reset(), or skip() invocations will throw an IOException. Closing a previously closed stream has no effect.
        Specified by:
        close in interface Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Overrides:
        close in class BufferedInputStream
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
        See Also:
        FilterInputStream.in
